books.title: Orlando Furioso
books.author: Ludovico Ariosto
books.summary: A beautiful woman lures a knight away from his duty to protect Europe from invaders.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: Jeeves Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring Jeeves and Wooster and the upperclass English life of the early 1900s.

books.title: The Tempest
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A magic-induced tempest shipwrecks the king of Naples and his crew on an island inhabited by the usurped duke of Milan.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: Toilers of the Sea
books.author: Victor Hugo
books.summary: A man from Guernsey offers his help in a dangerous trial to salvage a wrecked ship.

books.title: The Turn of the Screw
books.author: Henry James
books.summary: A governess moves in to a haunted manor.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: Monsieur Lecoq
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: Monsieur Lecoq’s first case in which he tries to determine the identity of a man in custody for three murders.

books.title: The New Freedom
books.author: Woodrow Wilson
books.summary: The 28th president of the United States presents the risks and opportunities for freedom and democracy through a series of campaign speeches.

books.title: An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
books.author: David Hume
books.summary: Hume examines the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality and human understanding.

books.title: A Cycle of the West
books.author: John G. Neihardt
books.summary: A series of epic poems that recounts the history, legends, and mythology of the American West.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: The Maracot Deep
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A scientific expedition stumbles upon the remnants of Atlantis.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
